request.description:
Receive, log and deliver packages throughout the building. Sort and process incoming and outgoing daily mail.
If you unable to fulfill your time slot you signed up for, we ask that you email both smonico@mos.org and hyoung@mos.org as well as cancel it on quark.
request.dress: Rubber sole shoe is best, sneakers ok. Expect to get a little dirty.
request.training: Knowledge of museum buildings and staff locations.

request.description: Join the Discovery Center team for a day in this once-a-year opportunity to see what happens behind the scenes to keep an exhibit looking its very best. Projects may include: washing rocks, painting, organizing consumable materials, repairing a faux beaver's lodge, or laminating childrenï¿½s literature.
request.dress: Wear your dirty clothes (no joke) and sneakers.
request.training: No particular skills required. Feast on donuts (AM) or cookies (PM).

request.description: Join one of our outreach educators on a program away from the Museum at a school, library, or camp.
request.training: Learn on the job.

request.jobTitle: Put together 2018 Volunteer Fall Festival Invitations
request.description: We need help with the Volunteer Fall Festival invitation mailing. Thursday, September 27 9:00 am 6th floor Volunteer Services area 100% seated GSE
request.training: None

request.description: TO assist facilities personnel in the execution of daily tasks and project works.
request.dress: Presentable work clothes. Jeans, workshirt or T-Shirt (no torn or ripped clothing) and workboots or sneakers. Do not wear dress clothing.
request.training: Will be job specific, but will include safety guidelines and procedures.

request.description: Learn about the exciting world of Traveling Programs by participating in an on-site visit to a local school, library, or camp. GSEs will begin their day by meeting a TP educator at the crack of dawn in the Museum garage, helping load the van in the morning, riding along in a very colorful Museum van through Boston traffic, and checking-in at a local educational institution. Once the educator has finished setting up the program, GSEs can expect to serve as a spectator during the assembly or workshop program, as they witness the ins-and-outs of outreach education first-hand. (Note: Half-day shifts can sometimes run up to 4.25 hours. Full-day shifts are usually around 6 hours.)
request.dress: Comfortable casual clothing and Museum badge.
request.training: None--driving and teaching will be done by our staff.

request.jobTitle: Charles River Clean-Up Boat Volunteer - FULL Day
request.description: You will spend a full day on the Charles River Clean-Up Boat, patrolling the river for floating trash and debris and plucking it from the water. The boat will have one captain and up to 2 (Two) volunteers. The Charles River Clean Up Boat is a privately funded, 501 (c)(3), non-profit organization whose objective is to remove the floating trash from the Charles River. The Clean Up Boat has removed several hundred bags of trash since 2007, greatly improving the water quality and appearance of the Charles River for everyone, including our MoS visitors. For more information and to sign up for a shift on the Clean Up Boat please visit www.cleanupboat.org. You must sign up on the clean Up Boat website *before* signing up for the GSE. Please note that not all GSE dates will be available due to other Volunteer signups.
request.dress: Life Jacket, you can bring your own or one will be provided to you. Dress for being outdoors. It is suggested that you bring a hat, sunglasses, sun block, and rain gear (if any risk of showers).
request.training: None.

request.description: Walk across the street with our Blast of with Rockets class (grades 3-5) to launch the rockets they have been building during the week!
request.training: No training is required

request.description: Help the Membership Department by fulfilling new and renewing members' cards for mailing.
request.training: No training required.

request.description: Affix membership cards and stuff envelopes in the Membership office. Feel free to bring your headphones. Schedule can be flexible.
request.training: None. Basic envelope stuffing.

request.description: Help our members enjoy this special night just for them. You will have the opportunity to assist with check-in, raffle, or drop-in activities throughout the Exhibit Halls. We will provide pizza beforehand in the Membership/Science Central offices!
request.training: All needed information will be provided day-of.

request.description: Assist our evening Planetarium presenters with taking tickets and seating for the 7:30, 8:30, and 9:30 PM Planetarium shows, then stay and watch the shows themselves. PLEASE RESPOND BY 1 PM THE WEDNESDAY BEFORE. RESPONSES AFTER THIS TIME CANNOT BE ACCEPTED.
request.training: None.

request.description: Assist the Marketing department with the annual College Night event, where 4000+ students in the Boston area can attend Exhibit Halls without charge. Duties will include checking student I.D.s and providing them buttons for admission, overseeing an laptop email signup station, assisting with live presentations and more.
request.dress: Comfortable clothing and shoes (lots of standing). Ability to interact with large crowds.
request.training: Should be comfortable engaging with college students, providing them with some information and answering standard questions they may have.

request.jobTitle: Summer Thursdays: Star Trek marathon production assistant
request.description: Assist on production and logistics for Summer Thursdays: Star Trek movie marathon on Thursday, August 30 at 6:00 p.m., in the Planetarium. This new summer series offers nightlife experiences for adult audiences in the Planetarium!
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 4:30pm on day of program.

request.description: Scanning black and white photographs from the Museum's history. We'll set you up in the Archives Office in Lower Morse, feel free to bring headphones.
request.training: You will be given a template with technical info, so you just need to be comfortable with using a scanner and following the software prompts.

request.description: asdf
request.training: asdf

request.description: Assist and interact with guests throughout a before-hours event. NOTE: Assistance will only be needed until 8:45am.
request.dress: Business casual or red coat will be fine.
request.training: Professional and courteous, as you would interact with guests during museum hours.

request.description: Join a team of Outreach Instructors to help visitors at a community event with hand-on science activities. We also need help promoting museum programs and exhibits
request.dress: Casual--we'll loan a MOS polo shirt for the day.
request.training: Learn on the job.

request.description: Join educators from the Museum of Science at Fenway Park to facilitate interactive space activities for visitors to the "El Mundo Family Festival" on Sunday, August 26th from 10:30 am to 2:30 pm. Volunteers will meet at Fenway Park for the event, and detailed activity and arrival information will be provided before the event.
request.training: Lead educator will train how to run the "soaring satellites" activity on the day of the event.

request.description: Sand and polyurethane the wood interior of Live Presentations Super Cold Science Cart. Full day GSE. Report to Sue outside Exhibit Shop Doors at 9AM Friday September 7, 2018.
request.dress: TBD by Jerry Sullivan, Exhibits Shop.
request.training: Experience with sanding/staining.

request.description: Help our members enjoy this special night just for them. You will provide information to members as they arrive for the event and direct them to the Duck Boat loading area, Omni Theater, and Box Office as needed. You may be asked to assist with distribution of standby tickets and line managing at either the Omni Theater or Duck Boat loading area.
request.training: All needed information will be provided day-of.

request.jobTitle: Monday Oct. 22, 2018 Volunteer Fall Festival Assistant
request.description: On Monday, October 22 the Volunteer Service League hosts their Annual Fall Festival. The Fall Festival includes a buffet dinner and displays from the 2017 VSL Grant recipients. We need people for the registration table and to welcome the volunteers. Meet at 5:00 pm in the 6th Floor Volunteer Services office.
request.training: No special training

request.description: Assist on production and logistics for the STL GLD live music show on Thursday, September 20 at 8:30 p.m., in the Planetarium. This is the return of STL GLD to the dome and the opening night of the Fierce Urgency of Now community festival.
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 6:00pm on day of program.

request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for The Poison Squad on Wednesday, September 26 at 7:00 p.m., in Cahners Theater.
Pulitzer Prize winner and New York Times-bestselling author Deborah Blum tells the true David and Goliath tale of how food was made safe in the United States and the heroes, led by the inimitable Dr. Harvey Washington Wiley, who fought for change. Book signing to follow.
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:00pm on day of program.

request.jobTitle: Killing Cancer with Cannabis production assistant
request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for Killing Cancer with Cannabis on Monday, October 1 at 7:00 p.m., in Cahners Theater.
Success stories of cannabis curing cancer are not new, but theyï¿½ve often been anecdotal. The precise cannabinoids that kill specific cancer cells have not been identified ï¿½ until now. David (Dedi) Meiri, PhD, is discovering which combinations of the cannabis compounds are able to destroy which specific cancer types. Find out about Meiriï¿½s game-changing research and the promise that medical marijuana may hold in the battle against cancer. Reception to follow.
In conversation with Kara Miller, host and executive editor of WGBHï¿½s Innovation Hub
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:30pm on day of program.

request.jobTitle: Fake Science with ImprovBoston production assistant
request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for Fake Science with ImprovBoston comedy show on Thursday, October 4 at 7:30 p.m., in the Planetarium.
This fall for one night only, ImprovBoston returns to the Museum of Science for a completely improvised adult comedy show that's out of this world! New England's oldest and biggest comedy theater brings its signature off-the-cuff laughs to the far reaches of the galaxy with the expert technological wizardry of the Planetarium. Immersive science meets immersive comedy as ImprovBoston's professional improvisers create games, scenes, and songs out of thin air using the Planetarium's state-of-the-art projections, surround sound, and 360-degree videos.
Art and science collide in a supernova of gut laughsï¿½ and you have a front row seat. For ImprovBoston and the Museum of Science, all the universe is a stage!
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:30pm on day of program.

request.jobTitle: The Big Quiz Thing production assistant
request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for The Big Quiz Thing on Tuesday, October 9 at 7:30 p.m., in the Planetarium.
The Big Quiz Thing returns, bringing its multimedia quiz-show spectacular to the Charles Hayden Planetarium! Hosted by Quizmaster Wes Hazard, the Big Quiz Thing is more than a bar trivia event: itï¿½s a full team-based game show, with video and audio puzzles, the Lightning Round, the Buzzertastic Finale, and the best, most ï¿½figureoutableï¿½ trivia questions anywhere. And it's all played via the BQTï¿½s unique digital answer system (play on your smartphone or another digital device).
Plus, thereï¿½s hope for the non-geeky: Smart-Ass Points for wrong but funny answers. All for honor, glory, and prizes. Learn more about the Big Quiz Thing at BigQuizThing.com.
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:30pm on day of program.

request.jobTitle: Boston's Best Drag Queens production assistant
request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for Boston's Best Drag Queens show on Thursday, October 11 at 7:30 p.m., in the Planetarium.
After taking Boston nightlife to exciting new levels as part of Summer Thursdays, Bostonï¿½s Best Drag Queens return to the Charles Hayden Planetarium with an all-new groundbreaking lineup of drag performances. Join us for an incredible fusion of drag and fulldome visuals!
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:30pm on day of program.

request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for Nancy on Wednesday, October 17 at 7:00 p.m., in Cahners Theater.
A show about how we define ourselves and the journey it takes to get there. Nancy is a critically-acclaimed podcast featuring LGBTQ stories and conversations hosted by two best friends, neither of whom is named Nancy. Itï¿½s a podcast about how we define ourselves, and the journey it takes to get there. Join us for a live taping of the popular podcast! Reception to follow.
Nancy is from WNYC Studios.
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:30pm on day of program.

request.jobTitle: Walter Sickert and the Army of Broken Toys Halloween Happening production assistant
request.description: Assist on production and logistics for Walter Sickert and the Army of Broken Toys Halloween Happening on Thursday, October 25 at 7:30 p.m., in the Planetarium. Walter Sickert and the Army of Broken Toys return to the Museum of Science for one night only! Kick off your Halloween as the Toys take over the Charles Hayden Planetarium for an unforgettable evening of masquerade, music, and mayhem under the dome. Beware, they're not alone ï¿½ other tricks and treats lurk around every corner of the Toys' macabre Museum!
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:30pm on day of program.

request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for Our (Super)Human Brains on Wednesday, November 14 at 7:00 p.m., in Cahners Theater.
If you could experience someone elseï¿½s feelings, imagine what you could do with that superpower. If you could get your body to metabolize dessert as if it were a diet food, think of how you could exercise that superpower. Treat yourself to an unusual excursion into the world of a doctor who uses his (super)synesthetic brain to treat patients, and learn about the secrets of your own (super)human brain. Book signing to follow.
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:00pm on day of program.

request.jobTitle: How To Dress Well production assistant
request.description:
Assist on production and logistics for the How To Dress Well live music show on Thursday, November 15 at 7:30 p.m., in the Planetarium.
For one-night only, How to Dress Well comes to the Museum of Science for an incredible, visionary live performance in the Charles Hayden Planetarium. Experience the music of the acclaimed singer/songwriter live like never before ï¿½ in the intimate, immersive setting of the full dome, while innovative visuals inspired by How to Dress Well unfold above and around you.
request.training: Training provided at Reg Table in Lobby at 5:30pm on day of program.
